snippet: Though Pat McCrory still has supporters in Charlotte, N.C., other city residents are dismayed by his emergence as a symbol of the legislature’s conservative agenda.
abstract: Charlotte NC feels estranged from Republican Gov Pat McCrory, its former moderate mayor, after state's effort to quash city's antidiscrimination ordinance; residents resent controversy that has cost city estimated $86 million in lost revenue; city's surge in prosperity liberalized its politics, while McCrory's move to capital necessitated rightward shift

byline.contributor: Emily Harris contributed reporting, and Kitty Bennett contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Though Pat McCrory still has supporters in Charlotte, N.C., other city residents are dismayed by his emergence as a symbol of the legislature’s conservative agenda.

headline.main: Reeling Over Bias Rules, Charlotte Fights North Carolina Governor It Once Called Mayor
headline.print_headline: Reeling Over Bias Rules, North Carolina City Fights Governor It Once Called Mayor
